Actually the one you mean is a straight capture, right out of the camera. I have Nikon's "Active D-Lighting" enabled though, and that, together with 14-bit RAW, should compress the dynamic range a bit, at least that's the theory.

In general, underexposing normally does the trick as well, probably at the expense of shadows. Otoh, there are not many shadows anyway ðŸ™‚

I guess even a polarizer may help. One would have to try.
